治愈；给…吃药；给…吃泻药；施以医疗；（physic的第三人称单数形式）

1.en: He has an advantage over me in chemistry, but I gain an advantage over him in physics.
1.cn: 他的化学学得比我好，但我的物理比他好。

2.en: It's cool to be very good at anything in a girls school - maths, sciences or physics. No one will ask why you're doing a boys' subject.
2.cn: 在女校擅长数学、科学及物理是件很酷的事情，没人会问你为什么要做男孩感兴趣的事情。

3.en: The overall aim is to understand the changing roles of physics and of physicists over the course of the twentieth century.
3.cn: 整体目标是要了解物理学与物理学家们在廿世纪中不断变换的角色。

0.en: The name's Bender. Atomic physics. And you are?
0.cn: 我是本德。主修原子物理学。而你是？

1.en: Now, you said on the phone that your area of study is physics. Yeah, experimental physics.
1.cn: 你在电话里说你的研究领域是物理？对，实验物理学。

2.en: A little physics? There's no such thing. Physics encompasses the entire universe, from quantum particles to supernovas, from spinning electrons to spinning galaxies.
2.cn: 一点物理学？没有这个说法，物理学包含整个宇宙，从量子粒子到超新星，从自旋电子到旋转星系。

3.en: Toad of truth? Is that a physics thing? No, that's a crazy thing.
3.cn: 真理的蛤蟆？这是物理学上的名词吗？不，那是疯狂的产物。

4.en: Dr. Cooper, the physics department chair tells me you're refusing to take your vacation.
4.cn: 库珀博士，物理学部门的主席告诉我你不肯休假。

5.en: It defied your laws of physics, to transport matter through time and space.
5.cn: 这打破了你们的物理学定理，物质一定要通过时间空间传输。

6.en: So if any of you are considering going into experimental physics, my door is always open.
6.cn: 考虑加入实验物理学行业的同学们，我的大门永远向你们敞开。

7.en: Thanks, Raj. Okay, so here's the thing: I was wondering if you could maybe teach me a little physics?
7.cn: 谢谢，拉杰。事情是这样的，我想请你教我一点物理学。

8.en: But, you know, when it connects to physics, gas up the Ford, Martha, we're going for a drive.
8.cn: 但是当它跟物理学关联起来，给马喂好草料，师弟，咱们要直奔西天啦。

9.en: When you understand the laws of physics, Penny, anything is possible. And may I add: mwuh-ha-ha.
9.cn: 当你领悟到物理学的真谛之后，佩妮，一切皆有可能，我能不能再加一句，木哈哈。

10.en: Interesting. I suppose if someone could teach sign language to KoKo the gorilla, I could teach you some rudimentary physics.
10.cn: 有意思，既然别人能教KoKo大猩猩学手语，我也能教你基本物理学。

11.en: And I don't need to tell you, there aren't a lot of men who love physics, archaic languages and flags of the world.
11.cn: 毕竟不用我说你也知道，这世上很少有同样热爱物理学，古代语言和旗帜的人。

12.en: He was a concert pianist, traveled quite a bit. He also held a degree in physics from MIT. Sounds amazing.
12.cn: 他是一个演奏钢琴家，他去过不少地方，同时拥有麻省理工的物理学学位。听起来棒极了。

13.en: And I got him this amazing autographed copy of the Feynman lectures on physics. Nice. I got him a sweater.
13.cn: 而我送给他这份完美的，有费曼亲笔签名的关于物理学演讲的拷贝。太棒了，我要送他一件毛衣。

14.en: They're very different. Physics answers the question: what is the nature of the universe? Geology answers the question: what'd I just trip over?
14.cn: 这两者差别极大。物理学解答了：宇宙的本质是什么？地质学解答了：我刚才是被什么绊倒了？

15.en: In short, any one who told you that you would someday be able to make any significant contribution to physics, played a cruel trick on you, a cruel trick indeed.
15.cn: 简单来说如果谁告诉你们你们有朝一日能在物理学上有所建树，那完全是个残忍的笑话，太残忍了。

16.en: I'm sorry, I'm confused. President Siebert said you were focusing on some important physics work and I should take over your lab in the interim. Hey, that was my exciting news.
16.cn: 抱歉，我没搞懂。塞伯特校长说你目前要投入到重要的物理学研究中在此期间由我来接管你的实验室。讨厌，你怎么把我的好消息说出来了。

17.en: I win the Nobel Prize for Physics. Not yet. Get to it!
17.cn: 我赢得诺贝尔物理学奖。还没到时候。那就赶紧啊！

18.en: Get anything good? Just the latest copy of applied particle physics quarterly.
18.cn: 有什么好东西吗？最近一季度的应用粒子物理学报。

19.en: This is the greatest advance in modern physics since the splitting of the atom.
19.cn: 这是近代物理学自成功核分裂后的最大发现。
